title: Enhance `datalad siblings` to list all (including not yet enabled) special remotes

labels.name: severity-wishlist
labels.description: feature request, or bugs that are very difficult to fix due to design issues

body:
ATM
```shell
$> datalad  siblings    
.: here(+) [git]
.: s3-PUBLIC(+) [git]
.: origin(-) [https://github.com/OpenNeuroDatasets/ds000001 (git)]
```
whenever
```shell
$> git annex info
repository mode: indirect
trusted repositories: 0
semitrusted repositories: 5
	00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001 -- web
 	00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002 -- bittorrent
 	1b4b718e-91d9-4da9-9b80-02a2d1bb9363 -- s3-PRIVATE
 	2f2712ed-a89d-4216-9a8c-0237503e0db4 -- yoh@hopa:/tmp/ds000001 [here]
 	b5dd2e3d-825f-4bc2-b719-cba1059f6bfc -- root@93184394ac19:/datalad/ds000001
untrusted repositories: 1
	deaa691f-c824-4416-9bf8-a94a47dd31b5 -- [s3-PUBLIC]
transfers in progress: none
available local disk space: 20.51 gigabytes (+1 megabyte reserved)
local annex keys: 0
local annex size: 0 bytes
annexed files in working tree: 80
size of annexed files in working tree: 2.42 gigabytes
bloom filter size: 32 mebibytes (0% full)
backend usage: 
	MD5E: 80
```
we seems to
- list only enabled
   - [ ] would be nice to get `--all` flag or a like to list all known remotes, e.g. here `s3-PRIVATE`, `root@93184394ac19:/datalad/ds000001`. Not sure about web and torrent since they are omnipresent
- even for special remotes list them as `[git]` (I guess because there a git remote configured for it now by annex, although git can do nothing with it).  
   - [ ] Would be nice to have annex special remotes as `[annex-special]`, git remotes with annex-uuid as `[annex]`.
